intro: Campanula farinosa, commonly known as the floury bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and clusters of bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Campanula farinosa is often found in alpine and rocky habitats, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders in horticulture.
